full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 755 Filed 08/10/22 Page 225 of 262 1936 LC8Cmax7 Rodgers - cross 1 Q. But the Palm Beach residence was mainly for weekend travel and that sort of thing? 2 A. We primarily went there on the weekend. 3 Q. So you took a lot of flights to Teterboro to Palm Beach and back again; right? 4 A. Yes 5 Q. Typically, if you're going to do weekend travel, you're leaving on a Thursday or Friday and you come back on, say, a Sunday; right? 6 A. Yes. 7 Q. And Ghislaine Maxwell wasn't always with Mr. Epstein when you went to Palm Beach; isn't that right? 8 A. Correct. 9 Q. Let's take a look at one flight. If we can pull back up Government Exhibit 662R at page 92. I want you to take a look at the flight on May 4th, 2002. That is down at the bottom, flight 92. Do you see that? 10 A. What's the flight number? 11 Q. Flight 92. 12 A. Yes, I see that. 13 Q. That is a flight from JFK to Palm Beach? 14 A. Correct. 15 Q. The passengers on that flight were Jeffrey Epstein and a woman named Shelly Lewis? 16 A. Correct. SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00013503

1 Q. But the Palm Beach residence was mainly for weekend travel and that sort of thing? 2 A. We primarily went there on the weekend. 3 Q. So you took a lot of flights to Teterboro to Palm Beach and back again; right? 4 A. Yes 5 Q. Typically, if you're going to do weekend travel, you're leaving on a Thursday or Friday and you come back on, say, a Sunday; right? 6 A. Yes. 7 Q. And Ghislaine Maxwell wasn't always with Mr. Epstein when you went to Palm Beach; isn't that right? 8 A. Correct. 9 Q. Let's take a look at one flight. If we can pull back up Government Exhibit 662R at page 92. I want you to take a look at the flight on May 4th, 2002. That is down at the bottom, flight 92. Do you see that? 10 A. What's the flight number? 11 Q. Flight 92. 12 A. Yes, I see that. 13 Q. That is a flight from JFK to Palm Beach? 14 A. Correct. 15 Q. The passengers on that flight were Jeffrey Epstein and a woman named Shelly Lewis? 16 A. Correct.
